name: Xcode
description: Build, test or archive an Xcode workspace on macOS. Optionally package an app.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: actions
inputs.label: Actions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a space-delimited list of actions. Valid options are `build`, `clean`, `test`, `analyze`, and `archive`. For example: `clean build` would run a clean build. See the [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html).

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Xcode project or workspace configuration to be built. The default value of this field is the variable `$(Configuration)`. When using a variable, make sure to specify a value (for example, `Release`) on the **Variables** tab.

inputs.name: sdk
inputs.label: SDK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify an SDK to use when building the Xcode project or workspace. From the macOS Terminal application, run `xcodebuild -showsdks` to display the valid list of SDKs. The default value of this field is the variable `$(SDK)`. When using a variable, make sure to specify a value (for example, `iphonesimulator`) on the **Variables** tab.

inputs.name: xcWorkspacePath
inputs.label: Workspace or project path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a relative path from the root of the repository to the Xcode workspace or project. For example: `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace` or `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace/MyApp.xcodeproj`. Do not specify a value if you use the `-target` argument under **Advanced** > **Arguments** (below).

inputs.name: scheme
inputs.label: Scheme
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional, unless you specify a **Workspace Path** above.) Enter the scheme name defined in Xcode. It must be a shared scheme, with its **Shared** checkbox enabled under **Managed Schemes** in Xcode.

inputs.name: xcodeVersion
inputs.label: Xcode version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the target version of Xcode. Select `Default` to use the default version of Xcode on the agent machine. Selecting a version number (e.g. `Xcode 9`) relies on environment variables being set on the agent machine for the version's location (e.g. `XCODE_9_DEVELOPER_DIR=/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). Select `Specify path` to provide a specific path to the Xcode developer directory.
inputs..comment: //If you update the options here, be sure to update the Xcode.json build template as well.

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.label: Xcode developer path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a path to a specific Xcode developer directory (e.g. `/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). This is useful when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on the agent machine.

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicate whether an IPA app package file should be generated as a part of the build. Review additional controls in the **Package options** section (below).

inputs.name: archivePath
inputs.label: Archive path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify a directory where created archives should be placed.

inputs.name: exportPath
inputs.label: Export path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify the destination for the product exported from the archive.

inputs.name: exportOptions
inputs.label: Export options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a way of providing options for exporting the archive. When the default value of `Automatic` is selected, the export method is automatically detected from the archive. Select `Plist` to specify a plist file containing export options. Select `Specify` to provide a specific **Export method** and **Team ID**.

inputs.name: exportMethod
inputs.label: Export method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the method that Xcode should use to export the archive. For example: `app-store`, `package`, `ad-hoc`, `enterprise`, or `development`.

inputs.name: exportTeamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the 10-digit team ID from the Apple Developer Portal to use during export.

inputs.name: exportOptionsPlist
inputs.label: Export options plist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the path to the plist file that contains options to use during export.

inputs.name: exportArgs
inputs.label: Export arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter additional command line arguments to be used during export.

inputs.name: signStyle
inputs.label: Signing style
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the method of signing the build. Select `Do not code sign` to disable signing. Select `Project defaults` to use only the project's signing configuration. Select `Manual signing` to force manual signing and optionally specify a signing identity and provisioning profile. Select `Automatic signing` to force automatic signing and optionally specify a development Team ID. If your project requires signing, use the "Install Apple..." tasks to install certificates and provisioning profiles prior to the Xcode build.

inputs.name: signingIdentity
inputs.label: Signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a signing identity override with which to sign the build. This may require unlocking the default keychain on the agent machine. If no value is entered, the Xcode project's setting will be used.

inputs.name: provProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different schemes or targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, tvOS, watchOS).

inputs.name: teamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional, unless you are a member of multiple development teams.) Specify the 10-digit development team ID.

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter additional command line arguments with which to build. This is useful for specifying `-target` or `-project` arguments instead of specifying a workspace and scheme.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the working directory in which to run the build. If no value is entered, the root of the repository is used.

inputs.name: outputPattern
inputs.label: Output directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a path relative to the working directory where build output (binaries) will be placed.

inputs.name: useXcpretty
inputs.label: Use xcpretty
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to use xcpretty to format xcodebuild output and generate JUnit test results. Enabling this requires xcpretty to be installed on the agent machine. It is preinstalled on VSTS hosted build agents. See [xcpretty on GitHub](https://github.com/supermarin/xcpretty) for details.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to VSTS/TFS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to publish JUnit test results to VSTS/TFS.

messages.TempKeychainSetupFailed: Failed to add the temporary keychain to the keychains search path.
messages.ProvProfileDetailsNotFound: Failed to find details for the provisioning profile: %s
messages.ProvProfileUUIDNotFound: Failed to find the UUID for provisioning profile: %s
messages.MultipleWorkspacesFound: Multiple Xcode workspace matches were found. The first match will be used: %s
messages.WorkspaceDoesNotExist: The Xcode workspace was specified, but it does not exist or is not a directory: %s
messages.UseXcprettyForTestPublishing: When using xcodebuild, enable `Use xcpretty` to publish test results. For this build, no test results will be published.
messages.NoTestResultsFound: No test result files matching `%s` were found. Publishing JUnit test results will be skipped.
messages.XcodeSuccess: Xcode task execution completed with no errors.
messages.TempKeychainDeleteFailed: Failed to delete the temporary keychain created during the build: `%s`
messages.ProvProfileDeleteFailed: Failed to delete the provisioning profile `%s`.
messages.ExportMethodNotIdentified: Failed to automatically identify the export method to use from the archive file. This might cause errors during the build or produce an invalid package. Set `Export Options` to `Plist` or `Specify`.
messages.ExportOptionsPlistInvalidFilePath: The `Export Options` plist file does not exist at `%s`. Provide the path to a valid plist file.
messages.SchemeRequiredForArchive: The scheme must be specified to generate the package with xcodebuild archive and export.
messages.WorkspaceOrProjectRequiredForArchive: The workspace or project path must be specified to generate the package with xcodebuild archive and export.
messages.FailedToGenerateExportOptionsPlist: Failed to automatically generate an `Export Options` plist file to export an IPA. Please specify an `Export Options` plist file in `Package Options`.
messages.LocateXcodeBasedOnVersion: Locating the developer path for Xcode `%s`
messages.FailedToLocateSpecifiedXcode: Unable to resolve the developer path for Xcode `%s`. Set the `%s` environment variable on the agent machine, or set `Xcode version` to `Default` or `Specify path`.
messages.CantDetermineProvisioningStyle: The provisioning style was not found in a pbxProject file. Automatic signing will be used. If the project uses manual signing, auto-export may fail. As a workaround, `Export Options` can be set to `Plist` or `Specify`.
